WorkItem.Description: I've recently done a clean install of 64bit Vista and my mage RAWR is terribly slow.  It's been running for two hours and it's only on 16% optimized.  In the past, a full optimization may have taken me 30-40 minutes on 32-bit Vista, but now it's taking hours and hours.  I downloaded the 2.2.1 to compare against the newest version, made all of the same selections, and it is on 8% after only 10 minutes.  Is there a reason the new version is going much, much slower?

Comments.Message: I have not noticed this. Can you double check your settings for global and incremental optimizations?
I've tried it with both of those checked (on) and with both unchecked (off).
Can you post the character xml where this happens? I'll take a look if there's anything unusual going on.

Go to advanced options and make sure Incremental Optimizations option is checked. That is what is slowing you down.
I have a similar problem. Creating an Upgrade List used to take me 2-3 hours at most,. I ran for 16 hours and was 53% complete using v2.2.2. I've attached my character XML.
I do have Incremental Optimizations checked as suggested

Could it be that is just because you have different amount of items visible through filters? Also is this with exactly the same file? Adding more items as available (and not removing old ones to compensate) will increase complexity of the optimization.

As I mentioned in my first supplemental post, I have run this with incremental optimizations checked, and I get the same result.  I have no more items checked with v 2.2.2 than I did with 2.2.1.  In fact, I have less now and still have the same problem.

Murgos can you please attach the exact character xml where this happens. The one you posted has incremental optimizations disabled so I'm not sure if this is the same one you used. Don't paste it in text, add it as an attachment.
Here is my character.  Any and all help would be greatly appreciated.

Ok I've run the tests on this character. I'm not sure why it is overall so slow on your machine, I would imagine this has to do with processor power. On my dual core 3GHz machine I get the following results for full optimization at max thoroughness.

2.2.1: 30 seconds
2.2.2: 2 minutes

Main cause in lower performance is the new algorithm for calculating value of proc effects like trinkets and set bonuses. The new algorithm is a lot more accurate, but is also more computationally intensive.

I can see several possible options. One is to provide a setting to choose whether to use the new algorithm or the old approximation. Another is to lower the precision of the calculations. If you have any suggestions let me know.

I have a dual core 2.5GHz machine with 4 gigs of RAM.  Are you really proposing that the difference between your machine in 2 minutes and mine in 7 hours (today's attempt with the above character) is the processing power?  I understand that RAWR is computationally intense but that seems rather drastic.

Well I don't have a good explanation for that. I only have explanation for why 2.2.2 is slower than 2.2.1. Maybe someone else with 3GHz or faster machine can do the test for comparison to get more data points. For reference my test was on Intel Core 2 Duo E6850, 3 GHz, 64 bit Vista, .NET Framework version 2.0.50727.
I've made some performance optimizations which brings the test on 2.2.3 to 1 minute. I've also added a switch to revert to old calculations, will add a gui control in options later today/tomorrow.

I too have seen very slow results in Optimize. I started running Optimize at 3PM, for instance, and it just finished at 11PM. It was on 100% for over 2 hours alone (the second bar above the first bar was still going...)

And after all of that -- after 8 hours of running Optimize, I made a gem switch and increased DPS from 6995.52 to 6996.78. Optimize had put a Runed Dragon's Eye + Potent Monarch Topaz into a chestpiece giving a 6 crit bonus -- I instead switch these out for 2 Runed Scarlet Rubies, dropping the 6 crit bonus, and enabling me to move the runed dragon's eye into another piece which activated a 5 spell power bonus. I would think that in 8 hours of optimizing, it would have tried that.

I am on a dual-core 2GHz with 3GB of RAM. I run Optimize on max thouroughness.
Can you open that as another issue regarding optimizer results and attach the character xml, I'll take a look why it wouldn't consider that swap.

Can someone that had issues with performance in 2.2.2 check the latest version to see if the changes made improve performance to previous levels? If not try switching to Simple proc evaluation under general settings and see if that is better.
I'm having no performance issues with the new version, although I have trimmed down my available items making it hard to draw a direct comparison.
